title: üí∞ Client says it's too expensive
hint: Emphasize value, not price. Share student success stories and offer a free trial lesson.

title: üèÜ Client mentioned a competitor
hint: Highlight our advantages: live interaction, personalized feedback, individual approach ‚Äî things online platforms can't offer.

title: üòü Client doesn't see the value
hint: Ask what skills are important for their child right now. Re-segment based on their interests and goals.

title: ‚è∞ Client is delaying the decision
hint: Gently suggest: reserve a spot in the course, send materials via email, or schedule a follow-up call tomorrow.

title: üïê Time constraint issue
hint: Show flexibility: 15-20 minute micro-lessons, asynchronous access to materials, convenient lesson times.

title: üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß Family approval needed
hint: Offer to conduct a demo lesson with the child/parent together or send a presentation link.

title: üí∏ Budget constraints
hint: Offer flexible options: installment plan, multi-month package with discount, or individual instead of group lessons.

title: ‚úÖ Client doubts the quality
hint: Share success stories, parent testimonials, student project examples. Offer a trial lesson.

title: üë∂ Age concern
hint: Clarify the recommended age range. Show that there are groups for different ages with a personalized approach.

title: üíª Technical concerns
hint: Reassure: easy setup, tech support always available, there's a guide, we can help via call.

title: üòï Child lacks motivation
hint: Explain game-based approach, show fun projects kids create. Suggest trial lesson to spark interest.

title: üòû Had bad experience before
hint: Acknowledge their concern. Explain what makes our approach different. Emphasize individual pace and support.

title: üìö Worried it's too difficult
hint: Reassure: step-by-step progression, personal mentor support, we adapt to each child's pace.

title: üìñ Conflicts with school
hint: Position as complementary skill building, not additional burden. Flexible schedule around school commitments.

title: üåê Language concerns
hint: Clarify available languages for lessons. Emphasize that coding logic transcends language, visual learning.

title: ‚öñÔ∏è Wants to compare options
hint: Provide clear differentiation: live mentoring vs recorded lessons, individual progress tracking, community support.

title: üí≥ Asking about refunds
hint: Clearly explain refund policy. Emphasize satisfaction guarantee and trial period. Build confidence.

title: üë• Group vs individual question
hint: Explain benefits of each format. Small groups for social learning, individual for personalized pace. Offer both.

title: üìã Asking about curriculum
hint: Provide clear roadmap: from basics to advanced projects. Highlight practical outcomes and portfolio building.

title: üë®‚Äçüè´ Teacher credentials question
hint: Share teacher backgrounds, industry experience, teaching methodology. Offer to introduce the teacher.

title: üéÅ Requesting trial lesson
hint: Great! Immediately schedule trial lesson. Get preferred time slots. Explain what to expect.

title: üìÖ Asking about start date
hint: Show available start dates. Create urgency if spots are limited. Offer to reserve a place.

title: üñ•Ô∏è Equipment requirements
hint: Specify minimal requirements: laptop/PC, internet connection. Reassure most families already have everything needed.

title: üë´ Sibling discount inquiry
hint: Offer attractive sibling package. Emphasize benefits of learning together. Calculate total savings.

title: ‚ú® Positive signal!
hint: Seize the moment: suggest the next step ‚Äî book a trial lesson, payment, or sign the agreement.
